overview_of_class: Methods for treating material and geometric nonlinearities by finite elements; transient analysis: explicit and implicit time integration, partitioned methods and stability; hydrid and mixed elements; finite elements for plates and shells; convergence, efficiency and computer implementation.
name: Advanced Finite Element Methods II
title: MEAS MECH_ENG 426-2-20 Advanced Finite Element Methods II

instructors.instructor_addr: Technological Institute, Rm A326, 2145 Sheridan Rd, EV CAMPUS

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Methods for treating material and geometric nonlinearities by finite elements; transient analysis: explicit and implicit time integration, partitioned methods and stability; hydrid and mixed elements; finite elements for plates and shells; convergence, efficiency and computer implementation.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: To gain a strong understanding in (1) computational materials modeling, (2) alternative FEM formulations (i.e., eXtended Finite Element Method (XFEM) / Meshfree Methods), (3) Arbitrary Lagrangian Eulerian (ALE) formulation for large deformation, and Materials Modeling.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lecture: Two 1 and 1/2 hour lectures per week.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Nonlinear Finite Elements for Continua and Structures, 2nd Edition, Ted Belytschko, Wing Kam Liu, Brian Moran, Khalil Elkhodary, Wiley, 2013, ISBN 9781118632703. http://www.wiley.com/WileyCDA/WileyTitle/productCd-1118632702,subjectCD-ME40.html.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: Recommended - Meshfree Particle Methods, Shaofan Li and Wing Kam Liu, Springer, 2004, ISBN 3540222561. http://www.springeronline.com/3-540-22256-1

subject: MECH_ENG
